description: From French incruster, from Latin incrustare, from in- (“in”) + crustare (“to cover with a crust”). See crust.

verbs.description: encrust (third-person singular simple present encrusts, present participle encrusting, simple past and past participle encrusted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cover with a hard crust.
(transitive) To inset or affix decorative materials upon (a surface); to inlay into, as a piece of carving or other ornamental object.
examples: The jeweller encrusted the ring with gems.
